definition: an injury involving rupture of small blood vessels and discoloration without a break in the overlying skin : contusion
a similar injury to plant tissue
an injury especially to the feelings

to inflict an injury involving rupture of small blood vessels and discoloration without a break in the overlying skin or a similar injury to plant tissue : to inflict a bruise (see bruise entry 1 sense 1) on : contuse
examples: bruised her arm when he grabbed her

definition: to break down (leaves, berries, etc.) by pounding : crush
wound, injure, to inflict psychological hurt on
examples: The professional and personal tumbles that have bruised your ego in the past 12 months are over.

definition: to bear or show the effects of a bruise : to undergo bruising
